page.title: 02Landscape(windward/lee-side)
page.content:
In this section there is a very marked difference between the windward-side on the west and the lee-side on the east. The W.cliffs, which take the full force of the Atlantic gales,are steep,rugged and bare of vegetation save for thin grass and clumps of sea pink. In contrast the cliffs of the east side are much more gentle and clothed with fern and great banks of rhododendron.There are even a few pockets of stunted sea-leaning trees.
The plateau-like top is mostly grass- covered in the south but becomes dominated by fern, and then bracken, as you go northwards. In the north,where the island narrows, the lee-side is afforded less protection and consequently has less vegetative cover.
